intro: Melomphis arabica, commonly known as the Arabian coffee plant, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the Arabian Peninsula and is characterized by its woody stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, white flowers that are followed by red, fleshy fruits containing seeds. Melomphis arabica is adapted to arid environments and requires well-drained soil. However, it is considered rare and is primarily found in specific regions of the Middle East.
